item.title: CyberArk warns that allowing third parties access to your network can provide hackers with an entry point
item.description:
CyberArk, a cybersecurity firm, released a report highlighting the risks of granting external vendors access to company networks. Source: CyberArk. View the complete infographic here. “Cybercriminals often exploit vulnerabilities within IT security, particularly accounts shared with external vendors for network access,” warned John Worrall, Chief Marketing Officer at CyberArk. He added that these vendors often have weaker security measures compared to their larger counterparts, creating a point of entry for attackers...

item.title: The Ultimate Wireless Firewall: Networks That Don’t Connect
item.description:
By: John Shepler Network security has become a crucial aspect for any business with an internet connection. Reports of security breaches are alarmingly frequent, and it’s possible that we’re only seeing the surface of the problem. While publicized breaches often involve compromised customer data, including sensitive information like credit card numbers, many businesses choose to remain silent about intrusions that don’t directly impact their customers to avoid negative publicity. item.title: Access PC or Mac applications from iOS and Android devices
item.description:
Source: Parallels website. Parallels has launched an updated version of its Parallels Access app for iOS and Android. The app allows for remote access to both PCs and Macs, letting users access files and run applications while on the move. With Parallels Access, mobile devices can remotely utilize applications, edit documents, and search through files on a connected computer. Users can connect to any computer through a web browser without needing additional plugins or extensions...

item.title: ElephantDrive Never Forgets Your Files
item.description:
Elephants are known for their impressive memory. What if you could harness that power for your data? ElephantDrive is an online storage service that offers the digital equivalent of an elephant’s memory. ElephantDrive provides unlimited, encrypted storage that’s easily accessible and budget-friendly for individuals and businesses. Think of it as storage in the cloud. This offsite backup ensures your data’s safety, even if disaster strikes your primary location. Imagine losing your computer and backups to a tornado...
